result.execSummary:
The defendant Pedro J Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Pedro J Rivera is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Pedro J Rivera was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $8,901.53 plus surcharges; jointly & severally with 15CF1065.
May not have contact with Daniel P or his family, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay extradition costs of $56.71.

records.addlTxt: Dated May 16, 2018 - IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Thomas J. Erickson is relieved of further representation of Pedro Rivera in this matter. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Video from parking lot viewed in court during sentencing of co-deft 15CF1065 and deft and Atty Breitenbach were present and viewed video at that time.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes a total sentence of 20 years WSP:  10 years initial confinement w/credit for 343 days served; 10 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; restitution ordered in the amount of $8,901.53 (by stipulation of deft), joint & several with 15CF1065; pay extradition costs of $56.71 (by stipulation of deft); deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact with Daniel P. or his family.
